heading: passage: curtis mayfield, 57
subheading: mayfield was probably best known for "superfly," the title track to the '70s movie of the same name, but the depth and breadth of his singing career earned him a spot in the rock 'n' roll hall of fame. he began performing before reaching his teens and saw early success as a member of the impressions which had a string of hits, including "for your precious love" and "woman's got soul." although he stayed with the group into the '70s, mayfield increasingly performed as a solo act. in 1990, during an outdoor show in brooklyn, new york, he was left paralyzed after a light rig buffeted by strong winds broke loose and fell on him.
author: wired staff
